answers.answer: I think You meet w dietitian about gestational diabetes and monitor blood level by testing blood several times a day.
Thanks gigibella has me worried I've never been a sugary snack person not even pregnant so I'm kinda freaked out of this can happen

If you fail the three hour, they make you see a person about your diet and you have to check your blood sugar four times a day. Once when you wake up before you eat, once an hour after you eat breakfast, once an hour after lunch and once an hour after dinner.You have to do that the rest of your pregnancy as well as avoid and eat certain foods.BUT try asking your midwife if you can do the blood sugar checking or a week INSTEAD of the three hour test. I didnt want to do the three hour so my midwife let me do that instead. If by the end of the week my blood sugar was normal and healthy then I dont have to be deemed with GD. And plus the way I went is actually more accurate than the three hour test.
I failed my 1 hr an passed my 3 hr so dont stress to much. If you dont pass they will set up a diet for u
And so far my blood has been on point. So after my next visit I will no longer have to check my blood sugar
I failed my 1 hr and passed the 3 hr
I failed my 1hr n have to do my 3hr to my Dr. Said she will just teach me how to take my sugarso I can keep an eye on it

question: So I've seen a few post before about the test but never really opened them, well now hospital just called me told me I failed it and my sugar was super high ;( so have another 3hr test then what? If I fail that one what happends? Any one else going through this ? Any advice?
title: HELP...1HR GLUCOSE FAILED
